Content.BodyCopy:
Household Cleaners

Many household products contain acids, phosphates, ammonia, oxalic accid, VOC's, and much more. These toxins can cause dizziness, nausea, allergic reatctions, and eye, skin, and respiratory tract irritation; some can cause cancer.

Look for signal words: POISON/DANGER, WARNING, CAUTION, SENSITIZER (may cause allergies)

Try to use product cleaners that have gotten the designation GRAS: Generally Regarded as Safe. Companies such as "Seventh Generation" make a product line of non-toxic household cleaning products.

***Avoid scented detergents and softeners; fragrances are often toxic. Most major brands offer products that are free of dyes and fragrances. This is a great way to reduce your overall exposure, from the sheets you sleep in, to the clothes you wear. Throw a small muslin bag filled with dried lavender in your dryer for added non-toxic scent. ***

Mold Removal

Mold is a common source of allergies, and can contribute to chronic respiratory and sinus infections.

      • Tea tree oil is a natural fungicide. Use 1 tsp tea tree oil in a spray bottle with 2 cups water. Shake well, and spray on moldy areas. Do not rinse. Clean off dead mold with soapy water in a few days
      • 5% white distilled vinegar can be used in a spray bottle to kill mold. Do not rinse. Clean off dead mold with soapy water in a few days.
      • 1 cup borax, dissolved in 1 quart of water. Scrub walls, then let dry without rinsing. Vacuum the dust off walls a few days later
      • Shower Mold: Spray on a mixture of water and bleach. Let it sit then scrub off.

 

Homemade Remedies

      • Use "Woolite" as an alternative to dry-cleaning. If you must air dry, let the clothes air out in the garage or another remote location for a couple of weeks before moving them into your bedroom closet.
      • As an alternative to bleaching clothes, consider adding 8 oz of 3% hydrogen peroxide to your laundry load.
      • A spray bottle of 3% hydrogen peroxide can be used to wipe off counter tops, appliances, cutting boards, etc.
      • Grapefruit Seed Extract all purpose cleaner: 30-60 drops grapefruit seed extract in a 32 oz spray bottle mixed with water (use on sinks, toilets, countertops, floors, et.)
      • When cleaning dusty areas: Spray with a water/detergent mixture and wipe clean with a cotton rag

Alkaline All Purpose Cleaner

2 tsps Borax

½ tsp liquid soap or detergent

Enough hot water to fill spray bottle

1 tsp antiseptic essential oilCombined, add water, shake till completely dissolved

Acid Cleaner (hard water buildup)

¼ c. white distilled vinegar

½ tsp liquid detergent

Enough warm water to fill spray bottle

Few drops of essential oil for fragrance

Mix all together in spray bottle
